sentence.Network_en: I still love you even though I'd like to wring your neck.
sentence.Network_cn: 虽然我想掐死你，但我还是爱你的。

sentence.Network_en: Buyers use different ruses to wring free credit out of their suppliers.
sentence.Network_cn: 买主们千方百计想从供货商那儿无息赊购。

sentence.Network_en: He turned away to wring out the wet shirt.
sentence.Network_cn: 他走开去把湿衬衫拧干。

wring ... n. 绞, 拧, 挤, 扭 wring out 扭出; 绞出(水)来 press out squeeze twist wrest [七国语言]英汉公共大词典.

jx.jx_en_mean: clasp and twist one's hands together as a gesture of great distress, especially when one is powerless to change the situation
jx.jx_cn_mean: 苦恼地（或绝望地）绞拧双手

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English wringan (verb), of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch wringen, also to wrong

entry.def: If you wring something out of someone, you manage to make them give it to you even though they do not want to.

example.ex: Buyers use different ruses to wring free credit out of their suppliers...
example.tran: 买主们千方百计想从供货商那儿无息赊购。

example.ex: In this way, he hoped to put pressure on the British and thus to wring concessions from them.
example.tran: 他希望通过这种方式向英国人施压，从而迫使他们让步。

entry.tran: (通常因忧愁、焦虑而)绞扭双手（干叹息)
entry.def: If someone wrings their hands, they hold them together and twist and turn them, usually because they are very worried or upset about something. You can also say that someone is wringing their hands when they are expressing sorrow that a situation is so bad but are saying that they are unable to change it.

example.ex: The Government has got to get a grip. Wringing its hands and saying it is a world problem just isn't good enough.
example.tran: 政府必须采取切实行动，一味搓着手感叹说这是个全球性问题是远远不够的。

entry.tran: 扭断…的脖子(表示非常生某人的气)
entry.def: If you say that you will wring someone's neck or that you would like to wring their neck, you mean that you are very angry or irritated with them.

example.ex: That crazy Debbie! He could wring her neck for this!...
example.tran: 黛比那个疯子！他会为这把她的脖子拧断的！

example.ex: I still love you even though I'd like to wring your neck.
example.tran: 虽然我想掐死你，但我还是爱你的。

means.word_mean: 1. twist and press out of shape
2. twist and compress, as if in pain or anguish;

sentences.sentence: "They extorted money from the executive by threatening to reveal his past to the company boss"
"They squeezed money from the owner of the business by threatening him"

means.word_mean: 4. twist, squeeze, or compress in order to extract liquid;

auth_sentence.content: We cannot just stand around and wring our hands.
auth_sentence.res_content: We cannot just stand around and wring our hands.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We cannot just stand around and wring our hands.

auth_sentence.content: Emily's pathetic accents would wring the best of withers.
auth_sentence.res_content: Emily's pathetic accents would wring the best of withers.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Emily's pathetic accents would wring the best of withers.

auth_sentence.content: "Wring out the pads," Wheeler said to the resident.
auth_sentence.res_content: "Wring out the pads," Wheeler said to the resident.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "Wring out the pads," Wheeler said to the resident.

means.word_mean: 绞, 拧, 扭(尤指脖子)

sentences.en: I'll wring your neck if you don't behave!
sentences.cn: 你要是不规矩, 我就拧断你的脖子。

jushi.english: I'll wring your neck if you don't behave!
jushi.chinese: 你要是行为不端，我就拧断你的脖子。
